title: Tribal Councils
headline: Preserving Heritage through Modern Administration
subheadline: Digitize land records, manage community disputes, and maintain the royal census with respect for tradition and law.
description: Manage land rights, community census, and council resolutions.

painPoints.title: Lost Land Records
painPoints.description: Disputes arising from damaged or missing handwritten PTOs (Permission to Occupy).

painPoints.title: Census Gaps
painPoints.description: Uncertainty about exact community numbers and household heads.

painPoints.title: Meeting Documentation
painPoints.description: Lack of formal minutes for council resolutions and judgments.

painPoints.title: Revenue Leaks
painPoints.description: Poor tracking of tribal levies and business contributions.

features.title: Digital Land Registry
features.description: GPS-mapped plots linked to household heads and PTO certificates.

features.title: Dispute Resolution
features.description: Case files for land arguments with history of judgments.

features.title: Household Census
features.description: Digital registry of all families, livestock, and assets.

features.title: Tribal Court
features.description: Management of traditional court cases, fines, and outcomes.

features.title: Meeting Minutes
features.description: Secure storage for LeKGOTLA resolutions and attendance registers.

features.title: Levy Management
features.description: Tracking annual tribal levies and issuing receipts.
